instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Machine gets orange light, no fan spin.

Found it was missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL>. 

I tracked this back to <CHIP>U8050</CHIP> and found that <CHIP>U8050</CHIP> was not getting <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>.

I found that the SMC Creates the <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> signal.

I changed this SMC and still have the exact same issue, nothing has changed.

Any Idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
That signal appears later.
Did you check first signals from the power on sequence?
Try to start in SMC bypass, if you think about sensors error...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
How do I perform an SMC bypass, image assuming it is different than an SMC reset?

And yes ,I worked my way down power rails everything appeared to be present until I hit <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Press power button, connect MagSafe and keep pressing 5-10s...
